title.rendered: Top 5 Mistakes to Avoid When Hiring a Web Designer in Nigeria

content.rendered:
Hiring the right web designer can take your business to the next level. But hiring the wrong one? That can cost you time, money, and credibility.

Here are the top 5 mistakes to avoid when hiring a web designer in Nigeria:

 

❌ 1. Choosing Based on Price Alone

We get it — budgets matter. But going for the cheapest designer often means:
– Poor design quality
– Broken functionalities
– Lack of support or updates

🔍 _Instead: Focus on value. Ask what’s included in the price and check their past work._

 

❌ 2. Not Checking Their Portfolio

A designer’s portfolio tells you everything about their style, skill, and experience. Skipping this step is like hiring a chef without tasting their food.

💡 _See my live portfolio here: olami.com.ng/portfolio

 

❌ 3. Ignoring Mobile Responsiveness

Over 80% of Nigerians access the internet via their phones. If your website isn’t mobile-friendly, you’re losing visitors — and money.

✅ _Always ask: “Will my website work well on phones and tablets?”_

 

❌ 4. Not Asking About SEO

A beautiful website means nothing if no one can find it on Google. Many beginner designers ignore basic SEO practices like:
– Fast load speeds
– Clean code
– Proper meta tags and alt texts

📈 _Hire someone who understands on-page SEO and integrates it into the design._

 

❌ 5. No Clear Communication or Timeline

You don’t want a designer who disappears after collecting your deposit. If you don’t know what’s happening at each stage, you’ll end up frustrated.

🗓️ _Ask for a clear timeline, regular updates, and revision policies._

 

✅ Final Thoughts

Your website is your digital storefront — don’t leave it to chance. Avoid these mistakes and you’ll save time, stress, and money.
